attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister, in the last few days of his premiership, not to sign the new text for the European Treaty / Constitution without first renewing the promise made in his election manifesto - “We will put it to the British people in a referendum and we will campaign wholeheartedly for a Yes vote.”   We also remind him of his comments, after two “No” votes elsewhere in European referendums - “ You cannot have a rejection of the Treaty and bring it back with a few amendments and say “Have another go” . You cannot do that.” 

We further advise the Prime Minister, that we withdraw our permission for him to accept and sign on our behalf the new text for this Treaty, until he has renewed his promise to hold a referendum.
